snippet.textDisplay:
Explodatorium is the best song I'd have to say. And it turns out both this one and that one are by Manami Matsume, not Jake Kaufman. Lady's got real talent.

Jake's got a lot of talent too (just listen to Mt. Vesuvius from Ducktales Remastered), but this and Explodatorium are just amazing.
snippet.textOriginal:
Explodatorium is the best song I'd have to say. And it turns out both this one and that one are by Manami Matsume, not Jake Kaufman. Lady's got real talent.

Jake's got a lot of talent too (just listen to Mt. Vesuvius from Ducktales Remastered), but this and Explodatorium are just amazing.

snippet.textDisplay: You do plan on uploading one of the songs Kaufman actually worked on, right? I don't mean to sound pushy or take away from the awesomeness of this song. snippet.textDisplay: I was kinda sceptical in playing this game because I thought it would be one of those overly difficult games akin to the classic NES games. But if it's easily approachable, then I'll reconsider giving it a shot.
snippet.textOriginal: I was kinda sceptical in playing this game because I thought it would be one of those overly difficult games akin to the classic NES games. But if it's easily approachable, then I'll reconsider giving it a shot.

snippet.textDisplay: The difficulty is very manageable with multiple checkpoints and (free!) healing items. You can beat just about any boss by phasing through their attacks with the locket, and then even if you don't there are the healing items. That said, there are a few potentially-rage-inducing moments (like fan enemies whose whole purpose is to blow you off of platforms and into bottomless pits) but overall not bad imo.
snippet.textOriginal: The difficulty is very manageable with multiple checkpoints and (free!) healing items. You can beat just about any boss by phasing through their attacks with the locket, and then even if you don't there are the healing items. That said, there are a few potentially-rage-inducing moments (like fan enemies whose whole purpose is to blow you off of platforms and into bottomless pits) but overall not bad imo.

snippet.textDisplay: This game gives a fair challenge the first time through. New Game + on the other hand is a different story. I love this game and I'm pretty sure I'll go through it again after I beat New Game +. It really gives Mega Man 2/ Castlevania 3 vibes and reminds me of why I loved the NES when I was a kid.
snippet.textOriginal: This game gives a fair challenge the first time through. New Game + on the other hand is a different story. I love this game and I'm pretty sure I'll go through it again after I beat New Game +. It really gives Mega Man 2/ Castlevania 3 vibes and reminds me of why I loved the NES when I was a kid.

snippet.textOriginal: Im at the end of the game as well! So good! And I agree with you about the difficulty. A little too easy for me. But tons of fun!!!!

snippet.textDisplay: You've gotta give New Game + a try. It definitely amps the difficulty up. Only 2 checkpoints per stage, all the food trays drop bombs, all enemies take a full heart when they hit you.
snippet.textOriginal: You've gotta give New Game + a try. It definitely amps the difficulty up. Only 2 checkpoints per stage, all the food trays drop bombs, all enemies take a full heart when they hit you.

snippet.textDisplay: This is a perfect example of why Kickstarter can be awesome for video game fans. I bought this game Day 1 and am nearing the end, I've been having a lot fun. It takes parts from Mega Man, Castlevania, Duck Tales, Mario 3 and Zelda II to create the most entertaining game I've played this year. The mostly easy difficulty is perharps a bit of a negative, but there is some challenge to be found from time to time, especially if you break some of the checkpoints and don't spam the phase bracer. The soundtrack will easily be a contender for best of the year. It's mostly composed by Jake Kaufman, but there are a few tracks like this one composed by none other than Manami Matsumae, mainly known for her work on the very first Mega Man. She hasn't lost her touch!
snippet.textOriginal: This is a perfect example of why Kickstarter can be awesome for video game fans. I bought this game Day 1 and am nearing the end, I've been having a lot fun. It takes parts from Mega Man, Castlevania, Duck Tales, Mario 3 and Zelda II to create the most entertaining game I've played this year. The mostly easy difficulty is perharps a bit of a negative, but there is some challenge to be found from time to time, especially if you break some of the checkpoints and don't spam the phase bracer. The soundtrack will easily be a contender for best of the year. It's mostly composed by Jake Kaufman, but there are a few tracks like this one composed by none other than Manami Matsumae, mainly known for her work on the very first Mega Man. She hasn't lost her touch!
